meanings.definition: The quality or state of being hydrophobic.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophobicity of the material made it resistant to water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the hydrophobicity of different surfaces to understand how they interact with liquids.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophobicity of the umbrella was so strong that even the raindrops refused to touch it.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of water was like the hydrophobicity of oil, always keeping them apart.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophobicity of the fabric was so remarkable that water simply rolled off it.

meanings.definition: The tendency of nonpolar substances to repel water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophobicity of oil causes it to form droplets on water surfaces.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the hydrophobicity of certain molecules helps in designing waterproof materials.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophobicity of the soap made it impossible to wash off the stubborn stain.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophobicity of the leaf allowed water to bead up and roll off easily.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophobicity of the coating prevented any moisture from seeping through.
